Iron deficiency anaemia due to chronic bleeding is very rare. Another cause must first be ruled out before attributing it to haemorrhoids. Cf [[2C-355|i''tem digestive haemorrhage 355''']]

properties.question: What is a less common cause of iron deficiency anaemia that should be considered before attributing it to internal haemorrhoids?
properties.option_a: Chronic blood loss from peptic ulcers
properties.option_b: Iron deficiency anaemia due to chronic bleeding from internal haemorrhoids
